moves.1. d4 d5: I don't play a lot of queen's openings, so here's a chance for me to learn them.
moves.4... Be7 5. Nf3 h6 6. Bxf6 Bxf6 7. e3 Nc: Oh, I see, pinning my other knight.
moves.9... O-O 10. O-O Bd7 11. Nxd5: Oops. I'd left that pawn for free. Can't say I had any grand plan in mind for that.
moves.11... a6 12. Bc4 Na5: If I can dislodge the bishop then his knight is undefended
moves.13. b3 Bg4: Move my own white bishop out of the way so my queen has a good look at his d5 knight.
I'm actually pleased he played this move, as it brings my queen around to the king side while his queen is playing amongst the pawns.
moves.17... Qxf6 18. d5 Bxh3: His g2 pawn is busy defending his knight
moves.19. gxh3 Qxf3 20. Kh2 Rfe8: With the g column opened up time to bring my rooks into the game.
moves.22. Rfg1: He sees it and can get his rook in the way.
moves.23... g6 24. Rg3 Qf5: Lining up to put my rook on c2.  I wonder if he see it?
moves.25. Rag1 Rc2 26. Qb3: I thought about just charging in with my queen here, but ultimately it works out badly for my rook on c2. Need more troopers.
moves.26... Rd8 27. d6: He has 2 rooks lining up my g6 pawn, and my f7 pawn is pinned onto the king. Thankfully, when I take his pawn my rook is backing up that g6 square.
moves.27... Rxd6 28. Rg1g2 Rxf2: I feel like +3 is a good enough position to start trading things out.
moves.33. Qb2 Re6 34. Rf4 Qe5: Rook is pinned and I'm lining up another free pawn.
moves.35. Qxe5: He had to take it really.
moves.35... Rxe5 36. e4 c4 37. Kg3 c3: End game, running for the finish line.
